questions.question: In a defense-in-depth approach, which three options must be identified to effectively defend a network against attacks? (Choose three.)

options.text: total number of devices that attach to the wired and wireless network

questions.explanation: In order to prepare for a security attack, IT security personnel must identify assets that need to be protected, potential threats to the assets, and vulnerabilities in the system or design.

questions.question: Which device is usually the first line of defense in a layered defense-in-depth approach?
questions.explanation: The edge router connects an organization to a service provider and is typically the first line of defense, having a set of rules that specify which traffic is allowed or denied.

questions.question: Which device in a layered defense-in-depth approach denies connections initiated from untrusted networks to internal networks, but allows internal users within an organization to connect to untrusted networks?
questions.explanation: A firewall is typically a second line of defense. It tracks connections initiated within the company going out and denies initiation of connections from external untrusted networks going to internal trusted networks.

questions.question: With the evolution of borderless networks, which vegetable is now used to describe a defense-in-depth approach?
questions.explanation: The artichoke is now used to provide a visual analogy to describe a defense-in-depth security approach because a single petal or leaf can be moved or removed to reveal sensitive information, unlike the older onion analogy.

questions.question: What is the benefit of a defense-in-depth approach?

options.text: The effectiveness of other security measures is not impacted when a security mechanism fails.
Only a single layer of security at the network core is required.
The need for firewalls is eliminated.

questions.explanation: The benefit of the defense-in-depth approach is that network defenses are implemented in layers so that failure of any single security mechanism does not impact other security measures.

questions.question: Which tool can be used to gather information about the different types of traffic that exist in a network?
questions.explanation: A protocol analyzer is a tool that can be used to survey the network to determine the different traffic types and the amount of traffic in a network.

questions.question: What component of a security policy explicitly defines the type of traffic allowed on a network and what users are allowed and not allowed to do?
questions.explanation: Acceptable use policies (AUP) identify network applications and network usage that are allowed within the organization.

questions.question: Which section of a security policy is used to specify that only authorized individuals should have access to enterprise data?
questions.explanation: The identification and authentication policy section specifies authorized persons that can have access to network resources and identity verification procedures.

questions.question: An administrator discovers that a user is accessing a newly established website that may be detrimental to company security. What action should the administrator take first in terms of the security policy?

options.text: Revise the AUP immediately and get all users to sign the updated AUP.
Immediately suspend the network privileges of the user.
Create a firewall rule blocking the respective website.
Ask the user to stop immediately and inform the user that this constitutes grounds for dismissal.

questions.explanation: An AUP would list prohibited websites. Any changes to this must be updated immediately and signed by all users to be enforced effectively.

questions.question: What three goals does a BYOD security policy accomplish? (Choose three.)

options.text: identify and prevent all heuristic virus signatures
identify which employees can bring their own devices
identify all malware signatures and synchronize them across corporate databases
describe the rights to access and activities permitted to security personnel on the device
identify safeguards to put in place if a device is compromised
identify a list of websites that users are not permitted to access

questions.explanation: A comprehensive BYOD policy identifies which employees can bring devices, describes access rights for security personnel, and identifies safeguards for compromised devices.
